        "Step 5: Monitor the system resources (CPU, memory, network) during the concurrent uploads.",

        "Step 7: Verify the upload history displays all uploaded files with correct status and timestamps.",
        "Step 8: Verify the system performance remains acceptable (e.g., response time, throughput)."

    },

      "title": "Clause2Case Upload with Network Interruption During Upload",
      "description": "Tests the system's ability to handle network interruptions during the Clause2Case file upload process.",

      "priority": "medium",
      "steps": [

        "Step 7: Re-establish the network connection.",
        "Step 8: Verify the user can retry the upload without data corruption.",
        "Step 9: Upon retrying the upload, ensure the file uploads successfully."
      ],
      "expectedResult": "The system displays an appropriate error message during the network interruption, allows the user to retry the upload after the network connection is re-established, and successfully completes the upload upon retry.",
      "tags": ["Clause2Case", "upload", "edge_case", "medium"]
    },

      "title": "Clause2Case Upload with Special Characters in File Content",

      "steps": [

      ],

    },

      "title": "Clause2Case Upload Compliance with Data Retention Policy",
      "description": "Tests the system's compliance with the data retention policy after a successful upload. Verify the uploaded data is retained for the defined duration.",

      "priority": "high",
      "steps": [

        "Step 2: Log in with valid credentials: username 'testuser', password 'P@ssword123'",
        "Step 3: Click the 'Choose File' button and select a valid Clause2Case file named 'valid_clause2case.xml'",

        "Step 8: Attempt to access or retrieve the uploaded Clause2Case data.",
        "Step 9: Verify the Clause2Case data is no longer accessible or has been automatically purged from the system after the retention period.",

      "tags": ["Clause2Case", "upload", "compliance", "high"]
    },
    {
      "title": "Clause2Case Upload with Invalid Session Token",
      "description": "Tests the system's response when attempting to upload a file with an invalid session token.",
      "category": "edge_case",
      "priority": "high",
      "steps": [
        "Step 1: Navigate to the Clause2Case Upload page: https://example.com/clause2case/upload",
        "Step 2: Log in with valid credentials: username 'testuser', password 'P@ssword123'",
        "Step 3: Capture the valid session token from the browser's cookies or local storage.",
        "Step 4: Modify the session token to make it invalid (e.g., change a character or truncate it).",
        "Step 5: Using a tool like Postman or Burp Suite, craft an upload request with the modified session token.",
        "Step 6: Send the upload request to the server with the modified session token and a valid Clause2Case file.",

        "Step 8: Verify the upload status remains 'Failed' and the file is not uploaded."
      ],

    },

      "title": "Clause2Case Upload with API Integration Failure",
      "description": "Tests the system's handling of external API integration failures during the Clause2Case upload process.",
      "category": "integration",
      "priority": "medium",
      "steps": [
        "Step 1: Navigate to the Clause2Case Upload page: https://example.com/clause2case/upload",
        "Step 2: Log in with valid credentials: username 'testuser', password 'P@ssword123'",
        "Step 3: Configure the system to simulate a failure in the external API that processes Clause2Case data (e.g., by temporarily disabling the API or introducing a timeout).",
        "Step 4: Click the 'Choose File' button and select a valid Clause2Case file (e.g., 'valid_clause2case.xml')",
        "Step 5: Click the 'Upload' button",
        "Step 6: Verify an error message indicating 'API processing failed' or 'External service unavailable' is displayed.",
        "Step 7: Verify the upload status remains 'Failed'.",
        "Step 8: Verify the error message is logged in the system log with the API failure details.",
        "Step 9: Restore the external API to its normal operating state."
      ],
      "expectedResult": "The system displays an error message indicating the API processing failure, the upload fails, and the failure is logged with the API failure details.",
      "tags": ["Clause2Case", "upload", "integration", "medium"]
    },
    {
      "title": "Clause2Case Upload with File Containing Extremely Long Strings",
      "description": "Tests the system's ability to handle Clause2Case files containing extremely long strings that might exceed database column limits.",
      "category": "edge_case",
      "priority": "medium",
      "steps": [
        "Step 1: Navigate to the Clause2Case Upload page: https://example.com/clause2case/upload",
        "Step 2: Log in with valid credentials: username 'testuser', password 'P@ssword123'",
        "Step 3: Create a Clause2Case file containing extremely long strings (e.g., 4000 characters) in one or more fields (e.g., 'clause_text').",
        "Step 4: Click the 'Choose File' button and select the created file (e.g., 'long_strings_clause2case.xml')",
        "Step 5: Click the 'Upload' button",
        "Step 6: Verify either: a) the upload fails with an error message indicating that the data exceeds the maximum allowed length; or b) the upload is successful and the data is truncated appropriately without causing a system error.",
        "Step 7: If the upload is successful with truncation, verify the truncated data is stored correctly in the database.",
        "Step 8: Check System logs for data truncation warnings"
      ],
      "expectedResult": "The system either rejects the upload with an appropriate error message if the data exceeds the maximum allowed length, or successfully truncates the data and stores it correctly in the database without system errors. Log data truncation warnings in system logs.",
      "tags": ["Clause2Case", "upload", "edge_case", "medium"]
    }
  ]
}

        "Step 1: Open multiple browser sessions (at least 5) and navigate to the Clause2Case Upload page in each session: https://example.com/clause2case/upload",

        "Step 3: In each session, click the 'Choose File' button and select a valid Clause2Case file (e.g., 'valid_clause2case_1.xml', 'valid_clause2case_2.xml', etc.)",
        "Step 4: In each session, click the 'Upload' button simultaneously.",
        "Step 5: Monitor the system resources (CPU, memory, network) during the concurrent uploads.",
        "Step 6: Verify all uploads are completed successfully without any errors or data corruption.",
        "Step 7: Verify the upload history displays all uploaded files with correct status and timestamps.",
        "Step 8: Verify the system performance remains acceptable (e.g., response time, throughput)."
      ],
      "expectedResult": "All Clause2Case files are uploaded successfully without any errors or data corruption, the system resources remain within acceptable limits, and the system performance remains acceptable during concurrent uploads.",
      "tags": ["Clause2Case", "upload", "integration", "medium"]
    },
    {
      "title": "Clause2Case Upload with Network Interruption During Upload",
      "description": "Tests the system's ability to handle network interruptions during the Clause2Case file upload process.",
      "category": "edge_case",
      "priority": "medium",
      "steps": [
        "Step 1: Navigate to the Clause2Case Upload page: https://example.com/clause2case/upload",
        "Step 2: Log in with valid credentials: username 'testuser', password 'P@ssword123'",
        "Step 3: Click the 'Choose File' button and select a valid Clause2Case file (e.g., 'valid_clause2case.xml')",
        "Step 4: Click the 'Upload' button.",
        "Step 5: Simulate a network interruption (e.g., disconnect the network cable, disable Wi-Fi) during the upload process.",
        "Step 6: Verify an appropriate error message is displayed (e.g., 'Network error: Upload failed').",
        "Step 7: Re-establish the network connection.",
        "Step 8: Verify the user can retry the upload without data corruption.",
        "Step 9: Upon retrying the upload, ensure the file uploads successfully."
      ],
      "expectedResult": "The system displays an appropriate error message during the network interruption, allows the user to retry the upload after the network connection is re-established, and successfully completes the upload upon retry.",
      "tags": ["Clause2Case", "upload", "edge_case", "medium"]
    },
    {
      "title": "Clause2Case Upload with Special Characters in File Content",
      "description": "Tests the system's ability to handle special characters in the Clause2Case file content.",
      "category": "edge_case",
      "priority": "medium",
      "steps": [
        "Step 1: Navigate to the Clause2Case Upload page: https://example.com/clause2case/upload",
        "Step 2: Log in with valid credentials: username 'testuser', password 'P@ssword123'",
        "Step 3: Click the 'Choose File' button and select a Clause2Case file with special characters in the file content (e.g., '&', '<', '>', '\"', ''', etc.) (e.g., 'special_chars_clause2case.xml')",
        "Step 4: Click the 'Upload' button",
        "Step 5: Verify the upload is successful.",
        "Step 6: Navigate to the Clause2Case Processing page.",
        "Step 7: Verify the special characters are displayed correctly without any encoding issues.",
        "Step 8: Check the integrity of the stored data in the database."
      ],
      "expectedResult": "The system handles special characters correctly, uploads the file successfully, displays the special characters without encoding issues, and maintains data integrity in the database.",
      "tags": ["Clause2Case", "upload", "edge_case", "medium"]
    },
    {
      "title": "Clause2Case Upload Compliance with Data Retention Policy",
      "description": "Tests the system's compliance with the data retention policy after a successful upload. Verify the uploaded data is retained for the defined duration.",
      "category": "compliance",
      "priority": "high",
      "steps": [
        "Step 1: Navigate to the Clause2Case Upload page: https://example.com/clause2case/upload",
        "Step 2: Log in with valid credentials: username 'testuser', password 'P@ssword123'",
        "Step 3: Click the 'Choose File' button and select a valid Clause2Case file named 'valid_clause2case.xml'",
        "Step 4: Click the 'Upload' button",
        "Step 5: Verify the success message 'Clause2Case file uploaded successfully' is displayed.",
        "Step 6: Wait for the duration specified in the data retention policy (e.g., 7 days).",
        "Step 7: Navigate to Clause2Case Processing page: https://example.com/clause2case/processing",
        "Step 8: Attempt to access or retrieve the uploaded Clause2Case data.",
        "Step 9: Verify the Clause2Case data is no longer accessible or has been automatically purged from the system after the retention period.",
        "Step 10: Check the system logs to confirm the data deletion event."
      ],
      "expectedResult": "Uploaded Clause2Case data is successfully purged from the system after the defined data retention period, and a record of the deletion is logged in the system logs.",
      "tags": ["Clause2Case", "upload", "compliance", "high"]
    },
    {
      "title": "Clause2Case Upload with Invalid Session Token",
      "description": "Tests the system's response when attempting to upload a file with an invalid session token.",
      "category": "edge_case",
      "priority": "high",
      "steps": [
        "Step 1: Navigate to the Clause2Case Upload page: https://example.com/clause2case/upload",
        "Step 2: Log in with valid credentials: username 'testuser', password 'P@ssword123'",
        "Step 3: Capture the valid session token from the browser's cookies or local storage.",
        "Step 4: Modify the session token to make it invalid (e.g., change a character or truncate it).",
        "Step 5: Using a tool like Postman or Burp Suite, craft an upload request with the modified session token.",
        "Step 6: Send the upload request to the server with the modified session token and a valid Clause2Case file.",
        "Step 7: Verify the server returns an error message indicating 'Invalid session token' or 'Unauthorized access'.",
        "Step 8: Verify the upload status remains 'Failed' and the file is not uploaded."
      ],
      "expectedResult": "The system rejects the upload request with an invalid session token and returns an appropriate error message ('Invalid session token' or 'Unauthorized access').",
      "tags": ["Clause2Case", "upload", "edge_case", "security", "high"]
    },
    {
      "title": "Clause2Case Upload with API Integration Failure",
      "description": "Tests the system's handling of external API integration failures during the Clause2Case upload process.",
      "category": "integration",
      "priority": "medium",
      "steps": [
        "Step 1: Navigate to the Clause2Case Upload page: https://example.com/clause2case/upload",
        "Step 2: Log in with valid credentials: username 'testuser', password 'P@ssword123'",
        "Step 3: Configure the system to simulate a failure in the external API that processes Clause2Case data (e.g., by temporarily disabling the API or introducing a timeout).",
        "Step 4: Click the 'Choose File' button and select a valid Clause2Case file (e.g., 'valid_clause2case.xml')",
        "Step 5: Click the 'Upload' button",
        "Step 6: Verify an error message indicating 'API processing failed' or 'External service unavailable' is displayed.",
        "Step 7: Verify the upload status remains 'Failed'.",
        "Step 8: Verify the error message is logged in the system log with the API failure details.",
        "Step 9: Restore the external API to its normal operating state."
      ],
      "expectedResult": "The system displays an error message indicating the API processing failure, the upload fails, and the failure is logged with the API failure details.",
      "tags": ["Clause2Case", "upload", "integration", "medium"]
    },
    {
      "title": "Clause2Case Upload with File Containing Extremely Long Strings",
      "description": "Tests the system's ability to handle Clause2Case files containing extremely long strings that might exceed database column limits.",
      "category": "edge_case",
      "priority": "medium",
      "steps": [
        "Step 1: Navigate to the Clause2Case Upload page: https://example.com/clause2case/upload",
        "Step 2: Log in with valid credentials: username 'testuser', password 'P@ssword123'",
        "Step 3: Create a Clause2Case file containing extremely long strings (e.g., 4000 characters) in one or more fields (e.g., 'clause_text').",
        "Step 4: Click the 'Choose File' button and select the created file (e.g., 'long_strings_clause2case.xml')",
        "Step 5: Click the 'Upload' button",
        "Step 6: Verify either: a) the upload fails with an error message indicating that the data exceeds the maximum allowed length; or b) the upload is successful and the data is truncated appropriately without causing a system error.",
        "Step 7: If the upload is successful with truncation, verify the truncated data is stored correctly in the database.",
        "Step 8: Check System logs for data truncation warnings"
      ],
      "expectedResult": "The system either rejects the upload with an appropriate error message if the data exceeds the maximum allowed length, or successfully truncates the data and stores it correctly in the database without system errors. Log data truncation warnings in system logs.",
      "tags": ["Clause2Case", "upload", "edge_case", "medium"]
    }
  ]
}
```
